review: I bought the chromecast believing I could screencast fromnmy android tablet to my TV, but turns out it only works with certain android devices, not the lenovo tablets that my wife and I both have. Pretty much everything else it does I can do with my blue ray player. I accept responsibility for not researching the product thoroughly enough before buying it. I would advise prospective buyer to check to see if you particular device is supported before buying.
author: R. Johnston

author: arkansasgreg

review: I absolutely love this device. It is cheap and does a lot more for it's price.As long as you have a streaming server (such as YouTube, Netflix, HBO Go) you're good. If you want to mirror a device or a browser tab, it won't work as smooth as a wired display - mirroring a playing video is not practical. It's not all that bad - there are solutions for streaming local files (photos and videos) to the Chromecast. My favorite solution for this is Videostream extension for Chrome. Maybe it's not as convenient as a media server, but let's all remember that this is just a streamer stick (and a wonderful one!).P.SI am disappointed that Amazon doesn't ship more than 1 device outside the US. Purchasing more than one or even purchasing one at a time is not possible for some reason...
author: Mickey Shnaiderman

review: I can't say enough good things about Google Chromecast. The applications that make use of it continue to grow. Showtime Anytime  updated it's apps to include support.  If you aren't content using a tablet or your phone as control device for it then go for a box device like the Fire TV or Roku. If you're like me and your mobile devices are an appendage, then you really can't go wrong.
author: Jared J

review: I'll be chilling on my bed in my room, then just use my LG G3 remote to turn on the television, and the chromecast also changes the input itself to hdmi 2, so I can start watching hbo go all without getting up. Lazy? yes. Awesome? also yes.
